person:biography.personal-details:content:
PRESENT POSITION AND ADDRESS:
Postdoctoral Research Fellow Institute of Biomedical Engineering and Nanomedicine National Health Research Institutes No. 35, Keyan Road, Zhunan Town, Miaoli County 35053,Taiwan Tel: +886-37-246166 ext. 37159 Fax: +886-37-586440 Mobile: +886-912126253 Email: pthuang@nhri.org.tw; pthuang.popo@gmail.com
PROFESSIONAL MEMBERSHIPS:
The Taiwan Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology The Biophysics Society of Taiwan Taiwan Neutron Science Society Taiwan Bioinformatics and Systems Biology Society Taiwan Proteomics Society The Pharmacological Society in Taiwan
ACADEMIC INTEREST:
I started a new project to study and the interaction between spider toxins and K+-channels. Late I went to the PhD program on DNase and expanded the project to further details of the interaction through determination of structure of K+-channels and related toxins. Meanwhile, as a parallel study, I tried to be involved in the MD simulation work containing additional biology membrane system. Of course I was also searching for all possibility with different methods to verify my theoretical results. I am interested in interaction between bio-membrane and proteins (BMP2/BMPR, VEGF/VEGFR). My current studies largely involve AFM, SPR, SAXS and SANS on protein complexs structure, 3-D modeling and docking of proteins. Listed below is a selection of skills which I have acquired during my graduate study.
Main Lab skills:
1. Expression and purification of proteins 2. Crystallization and structure determination of proteins 3. SAXS and SANS analysis of protein complex 4. LXD and Neutron reflection 5. 3-D modeling and docking simulation 6. MD simulation of interactions between biomembrane and proteins 7. other instrumental operation: AFM, SPR, HPLC, stopped-flow etc.
HONORS:
The Ministry of Education Graduate Scholarship 1996-2000 The Ministry of Education Graduate Scholarship 2000-2002 Graduating from Graduate Institution of Oral Biology, National Taiwan University in the honor of the top-rated prize (2002). One figure of the paper on Receptors and Channels was selected by the editor as “cover illustration” for that issue of this journal. The paper on Journal of Molecular Recognition was commented by the editor and reviewers for “excellent study”. Oral presentation “Improvement of Drug Virtual Screen by GA/GP: Docking Studies on Tubulin Inhibitors as Anticancer Agents” in ECM 25 (The 25th European Crystallography Meeting, Istanbul, Turkey, August 2009.) Graduating from Institute of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, National Taiwan University in the honor of the top-rated prize (2011).
REFERENCE:
1. Prof. Wei-Jung Chen Department Biotechnology & Animal Science National Ilan University No.1, Sec.1, Shennong Rd., Yilan City 26047, Taiwan E-Mail : wjchen@niu.edu.tw TEL : 02-23123456 ext.66616
2. Prof. Ta-Hsiu Liao Graduate Institute of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology College of Medicine National Taiwan University 9F, No.1, Sec. 1, Jen-Ai Rd., Taipei, 100, Taiwan E-Mail : thliao@ntu.edu.tw TEL : 2312-3456 ext. 88216
3. Prof. Chih-Yu Chao Department of Physics College of Science National Taiwan University No. 1, Sec. 4, Roosevelt Rd., Taipei, 100, Taiwan E-Mail : cychao@ntu.edu.tw TEL : 33665130
4. Prof. Horng-Huei Liou National Taiwan University Hospital and National Taiwan University College of Medicine 1, Chang-Te Street, Taipei, Taiwan E-Mail : hhl@ntu.edu.tw TEL : 0968611511
5. Prof. Ching-San Chen Institute of Plant and Microbial Biology, Academia Sinica 128 Sec. 2, Academia Rd, Nankang, Taipei 11529 Taiwan, R.O.C. E-Mail : chingsan@gate.sinica.edu.tw TEL : 0935514917
